title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 §§ 358-2.14 - Mass change in the Food Stamp Program
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 §§ 358-2.14 - Mass change in the Food Stamp Program

State Regulations

Mass change in the Food Stamp Program means changes
initiated by the Federal government or a social services agency which affect
all food stamp households or a significant portion of all food stamp
households. Mass changes may include, but are not limited to, adjustments to
income eligibility standards, shelter and dependent care deductions; the
thrifty food plan and the standard deduction; annual and seasonal adjustments
to social security, supplemental security income and other Federal
benefits. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18
§§
358-2.14

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
